channel.title: [V2.3]Epic Comeback[V2.3] New Update*
channel.description:
[B]IF YOU EVEN CLICK THIS TOPIC COMMENT[/B] Well, here is the beginning of my Epic comeback project. Tell me what you think.
[B]Version 2.3[/B] Full Scene: [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/V2-3.jpg[/img] Well, with some feedback, i fixed some things. i deleted 2 spears and added a new shield. slight changes to the scene's textures, and will continue to do so.
[B]Version 2.2[/b] Full Scene: [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/V2-21.jpg[/img] well, thats V2.2. tell me what to fix about the spears. [B]Version 2[/B] Full Scene: [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/V2-12.jpg[/img] Updates Since V1: Wood Floor. Updated texture on shield Updated Sword textures Roughened up brick wall Fixed wall texture
Tell me what you think, and what to fix and improve for V3.
[B]Version 1[/B] Full Scene: [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/EpicProjectV1.jpg[/img]
Sword Closeup [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/EpicSword.jpg[/img]
I think its sexy for a V1. The sword turned out better than i thought it would at first. when i made the hilt i thought "wow, this will look stupid" guess what, it didnt ;D What should i add for V2? So yea, here it is. Constructive criticism is welcome.

item.title: [V2.3]Epic Comeback[V2.3] New Update*
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:59, topic:285144”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=376851.msg2844181#msg2844181 date=1246166531]

hmm dylan can we get some wire frame pics? im curious to see how faces make up the weapons, i mainly would like to see the sword and shield, but whatever works best for you.

Umm, I hope you realise this was not made in meta. So I dont believe there are any wire frames for the model. Also, why? Its not that important, all a wireframe show is about how many faces are in a model anyways.
[/quote]

thats the reason i wanted to see the wireframes… if your smart enough to read my post you would see thats exactly why i wanted to see how many faces make it up…[/quote]
good luck learning from the wireframe. the whole scened is 1,100,000+ faces

here it is:

as i said, good luck =P

Read full topic

item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Lin:

That sword wouldn’t last a swing in combat. It would snap from the handle in an instant. Looks nice otherwise.

dude its a fantasy sword. who ever said i intended this for combat standards?incase you havent noticed, this was an “epic comeback” scene, not an "everything in the scene is functionabl for combat. functionable swords look plain for the most part.

Read full topic

Oh no wonder, your using displacement. Use it enough to get the shape of the brick out, use bump for the smaller detail.

item.title: [V2.3]Epic Comeback[V2.3] New Update*
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:48, topic:285144”][quote author=Frell link=topic=376851.msg2842781#msg2842781 date=1246069731]

add some actual texture to the walls, no walls or floors are perfectly smooth
EDIT:
heres my attempt at a wall stone wall texture in C4D

and a close up

its not perfect by any stretch of the imagination but it was about 10 minutes fiddling, but you can see how the textures are bumpier and that it disrupts the actual shape of the cube

To close and to intense bump map.
[/quote]
you think? i thought it would have to be a bit more intense because its meant to be that disrupted[/quote]
Then its to close, the farther away, the better bump looks.

Read full topic
